member.name: T:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient
member.summary: Watson TCP client, with or without SSL.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.StreamBufferSize
member.summary: Buffer size to use when reading input and output streams. Default is 65536.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.DebugMessages
member.summary: Enable or disable message debugging. Requires `Logger` to be set. WARNING: Setting this value to true will emit a large number of log messages with a large amount of data.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.AuthenticationRequested
member.summary: Function called when authentication is requested from the server. Expects the 16-byte preshared key.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.AuthenticationSucceeded
member.summary: Event fired when authentication has succeeded.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.AuthenticationFailure
member.summary: Event fired when authentication has failed.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.MessageReceived
member.summary: Use of 'MessageReceived' is exclusive and cannot be used with 'StreamReceived'. This event is fired when a message is received from the server and it is desired that WatsonTcp pass the byte array containing the message payload.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.StreamReceived
member.summary: Use of 'StreamReceived' is exclusive and cannot be used with 'MessageReceived'. This callback is called when a stream is received from the server and it is desired that WatsonTcp pass the stream containing the message payload to your application.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.ServerConnected
member.summary: Event fired when the client successfully connects to the server.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.ServerDisconnected
member.summary: Event fired when the client disconnects from the server.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.SyncRequestReceived
member.summary: Callback to invoke when receiving a synchronous request that demands a response.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.AcceptInvalidCertificates
member.summary: Enable acceptance of SSL certificates from the server that cannot be validated.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.MutuallyAuthenticate
member.summary: Require mutual authentication between the server and this client.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.Connected
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the client is connected to the server.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.ConnectTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: The number of seconds to wait before timing out a connection attempt. Default is 5 seconds.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.Compression
member.summary: Type of compression to apply on sent messages.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpClient.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke when sending a log message.

member.summary: Access Watson TCP statistics.

member.name: T:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer
member.summary: Watson TCP server, with or without SSL.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.StreamBufferSize
member.summary: Buffer size to use when reading input and output streams. Default is 65536.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.IdleClientTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Maximum amount of time to wait before considering a client idle and disconnecting them. By default, this value is set to 0, which will never disconnect a client due to inactivity. The timeout is reset any time a message is received from a client or a message is sent to a client. For instance, if you set this value to 30, the client will be disconnected if the server has not received a message from the client within 30 seconds or if a message has not been sent to the client in 30 seconds.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.MaxConnections
member.summary: Specify the maximum number of connections the server will accept.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Connections
member.summary: Retrieve the number of current connected clients.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.IsListening
member.summary: Flag to indicate if Watson TCP is listening for incoming TCP connections.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.DebugMessages
member.summary: Enable or disable message debugging. Requires `Logger` to be set. WARNING: Setting this value to true will emit a large number of log messages with a large amount of data.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.PermittedIPs
member.summary: Permitted IP addresses.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.AuthenticationRequested
member.summary: Event to fire when authentication is requested from a client.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.AuthenticationSucceeded
member.summary: Event to fire when a client successfully authenticates.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.AuthenticationFailed
member.summary: Event to fire when a client fails authentication.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event to fire when a client connects to the server. The IP:port of the client is passed in the arguments.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event to fire when a client disconnects from the server. The IP:port is passed in the arguments along with the reason for the disconnection.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.MessageReceived
member.summary: Use of 'MessageReceived' is exclusive and cannot be used with 'StreamReceived'. This event is fired when a message is received from a client and it is desired that WatsonTcp pass the byte array containing the message payload.

member.name: E:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.StreamReceived
member.summary: Use of 'StreamReceived' is exclusive and cannot be used with 'StreamReceived'. This event is fired when a stream is received from a client and it is desired that WatsonTcp pass the stream containing the message payload to your application.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.SyncRequestReceived
member.summary: Callback to invoke when receiving a synchronous request that demands a response.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.AcceptInvalidCertificates
member.summary: Enable acceptance of SSL certificates from clients that cannot be validated.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.MutuallyAuthenticate
member.summary: Require mutual authentication between SSL clients and this server.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.PresharedKey
member.summary: Preshared key that must be consistent between clients and this server.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Compression
member.summary: Type of compression to apply on sent messages.

member.name: F:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke when sending a log message.

member.name: P:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Stats
member.summary: Access Watson TCP statistics.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize the Watson TCP server without SSL. Supply a specific IP address on which to listen. Otherwise, use 'null' for the IP address to listen on any IP address. If you do not specify an IP address, you may have to run WatsonTcp with administrative privileges. Call Start() afterward to start the server.
member.param: The IP address on which the server should listen. If null, listen on any IP address (may require administrative privileges).
The TCP port on which the server should listen.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the Watson TCP server with SSL. Supply a specific IP address on which to listen. Otherwise, use 'null' for the IP address to listen on any IP address. If you do not specify an IP address, you may have to run WatsonTcp with administrative privileges. Call Start() afterward to start the server.
member.param: The IP address on which the server should listen. If null, listen on any IP address (may require administrative privileges).
The TCP port on which the server should listen.
The file containing the SSL certificate.
The password for the SSL certificate.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Initialize the Watson TCP server with SSL. Supply a specific IP address on which to listen. Otherwise, use 'null' for the IP address to listen on any IP address. If you do not specify an IP address, you may have to run WatsonTcp with administrative privileges. Call Start() afterward to start the server.
member.param: The IP address on which the server should listen. If null, listen on any IP address (may require administrative privileges).
The TCP port on which the server should listen.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Dispose
member.summary: Tear down the server and dispose of background workers.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Start
member.summary: Start the server.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.StartAsync
member.summary: Start the server.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.Send(System.String,System.String)

member.returns: Boolean indicating if the message was sent successfully.

member.name: M:WatsonTcp.WatsonTcpServer.SendAndWait(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Send data and wait for a response for the specified number of milliseconds. A TimeoutException will be thrown if a response is not received.
member.param: Number of milliseconds to wait before considering a request to be expired.
member.returns: SyncResponse.

member.returns: SyncResponse.
